title: LEGCO QUESTION NO.3 (Written Reply)
question_text: Question: Regarding the import of meat, will the Government inform this Council whether: (a) it knows if there are any international covenants prohibiting the transport of chilled pork and chicken from infected areas to other areas for sale; and (b) there is any legislation in Hong Kong prohibiting the import of chilled pork and chicken from infected areas; if not, the reasons for that?
reply_text:
Madam President, (a) To the best of our knowledge, there
is at present no specific international covenants prohibiting the transport of chilled
pork and chicken from areas infected by animal and poultry communicable diseases to other
areas for sale. (b) The Department of
Health regulates the food safety and hygiene standard of imported meat through the
Imported Game, Meat and Poultry Regulations made under the Public Health and Municipal
Services Ordinance (Cap 132). The Director of Health considers a number of factors
including the state of veterinary health and the hygiene standards of the farms,

including the state of veterinary health and the hygiene standards of the farms,
slaughterhouses and processing plants, etc of the exporting countries when deciding
whether import of chilled pork and chicken from a specific country/place is permitted.
Whenever appropriate, the Director of Health refers to guidelines issued by international
authoritative agencies such as the World Health Organisation, the Food and Agriculture
Organisation of the United Nations and the Codex Alimentarius Commission, for establishing
the appropriate regulatory and inspection mechanism. If there is evidence that the
imported chilled pork or chicken from a specific place may pose an infectious risk to

imported chilled pork or chicken from a specific place may pose an infectious risk to public health, the Director of Health has the power to prohibit such imports.

Asked by Hon WONG Yung-kan Date of meeting : 3 March 1999 Replied by : Secretary for Health and Welfare Question: Regarding the import of meat, will the Government inform this Council whether: (a) it knows if there are any international covenants prohibiting the transport of chilled pork and chicken from

international covenants prohibiting the transport of chilled pork and chicken from
infected areas to other areas for sale; and (b) there is any legislation in Hong Kong
prohibiting the import of chilled pork and chicken from infected areas; if not, the
reasons for that? Madam President, (a) To the best of our knowledge, there
is at present no specific international covenants prohibiting the transport of chilled
pork and chicken from areas infected by animal and poultry communicable diseases to other
areas for sale.
